question: Which of the following statements is true regarding AWS IAM?

answers.A: Password policy specifies the complexity requirement of a password and defines the mandatory rotation period for a password associated with IAM users.
answers.B: This is an extra layer of security protection for user authentication that requires users to enter a six-digit token on top of the username and password.
answers.C: A group is a collection of IAM roles.
answers.D: A secret key is a 40-character alphanumeric key that acts as a password or secret key
answers.E: A user is an IAM entity that constitutes one or more IAM policies defining resource permissions.
answers.F: A policy is a document written in YAML format that formally states one or more permissions as per the IAM policy standards
